articles.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

articles.description: This is it.

articles.title: Australia’s Albanese Pledges Deal to Save Rio Aluminum Plant
articles.description: The owners of Australia’s largest aluminum smelter have agreed to upgrade the plant as part of a government-backed rescue package aimed at keeping operations running beyond 2028.

articles.title: Laval police arrest two in break-ins at Greater Montreal businesses
articles.description: Laval police (SPL) said Wednesday that they arrested two suspects involved in several break-ins targeting pharmacies, eyewear shops and Sephora store across the Greater Montreal region. Investigators believe that the same suspects were behind various incidents reported in Montreal, Longueuil, Vaudre

articles.title: Canadiens’ Fowler makes 33 saves to win NHL debut vs. Penguins
articles.description: PITTSBURGH — Jacob Fowler made 33 saves in his NHL debut and the Montreal Canadiens beat the Pittsburgh Penguins 4-2 on Thursday night. Montreal gave the rookie plenty of support, as Alexandre Texier, Brendan Gallagher and Cole Caufield staked the Canadiens to a 3-0 lea

articles.title: Kiniéro delivers first ore to mill and commences operations
articles.description: Highlights: Robex delivers first ore to Kiniéro mill as part of commissioning activities Processing plant commissioning progressing in line with expectations Mechanical, electrical, and instrumentation systems performing in accordance with design Project remains on track for first gold pour in Decem

articles.title: China Southern Power’s Transelec Talks Are Said to Face Delays
articles.description: China Southern Power Grid Co.’s attempt to acquire control of Chilean power transmission company Transelec SA has hit a snag due to differences over valuation, according to people familiar with the matter.

articles.title: Struggles continue for Winnipeg Jets in 6-3 loss to Bruins
articles.description: Gabriel Vilardi, Morgan Barron and Alex Iafallo scored for Winnipeg but a woeful penalty kill and defensive lapses proved too much to overcome.

articles.title: Quebec adopts Bill 109, law to set quotas on French-language content on streaming platforms
articles.description: Quebec will now be able to impose minimum French-language content thresholds on major platforms such as Netflix and Spotify. On Thursday, elected officials unanimously adopted Bill 109, “affirming Quebec’s cultural sovereignty and enacting the Act respecting the discoverability of French-langu

articles.title: Magnitude 6.7 earthquake hits Japan’s northeast, tsunami warning issued
articles.description: A tsunami warning has been issued following a strong quake off northeast coast of Japan.

articles.title: Chilliwack General Hospital fundraiser launched for maternity clinic
articles.description: A new maternity clinic is expected to open in Chilliwack in February, and a fundraising campaign has been launched.

articles.title: Sharks top Maple Leafs 3-2 in overtime
articles.description: Alexander Wennberg scored at 2:49 of overtime as the San Jose Sharks came back from a two-goal deficit to top the Toronto Maple Leafs 3-2 on Thursday night.

articles.title: Takeaways: Ottawa Senators stop three-game skid with road victory over Columbus Blue Jackets
articles.description: Senators lose centre Lars Eller to lower-body injury

articles.title: Montreal researchers uncover possible treatment for inflammatory bowel disease
articles.description: Researchers from Montreal Clinical Research Institute (IRCM) have identified a new molecule, naturally produced in the body, could be used to treat inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). In a study published in the journal Blood earlier this month, researchers showed that Beta-hydroxybutyrate (BHB), a su

articles.title: ‘Catastrophic flooding’ in North America’s Pacific Northwest as rains ease
articles.description: Intense downpours were swept into the region this week by an 'atmospheric river' storm system from the Pacific Ocean.

articles.title: Pressure mounts on Quebec Liberal Leader Pablo Rodriguez to resign amid crisis
articles.description: A day earlier, Quebec's anti-corruption police announced they were launching a criminal investigation of the Quebec Liberals.

articles.title: Charlie Kirk murder suspect Tyler Robinson appears in court ahead of trial
articles.description: Robinson observed calmly as lawyers discussed procedural issues surrounding what is expected to be one of the most keenly watched trials in modern America

articles.title: Manitoba commissioner dismisses complaint about Tory pamphlet, volunteer comments
articles.description: A PC pamphlet before the 2023 Manitoba election campaign that detailed Wab Kinew's criminal past, didn't violate the province's Elections Act, the elections commissioner has ruled.

articles.title: Four-point night for Londoner Ryan Roobroeck lifts IceDogs past Knights
articles.description: The London Knights began three games in four days with a loss to the Niagara IceDogs in St. Catharines, Ont.

articles.title: Beaumont man’s guilty verdict in Treasa Oberly murder a relief for her friends, family
articles.description: The loved ones of Treasa Lynn Oberly, a Beaumont mom killed in July 2023, are relieved her partner Kenneth Skelly was found guilty of second-degree murder instead of manslaughter.

articles.title: N Korea’s Kim hails ‘ever-victorious’ army’s role in war against Ukraine
articles.description: North Korea’s Kim Jong Un tells key party meeting that fighting with Russia demonstrates the 'prestige of our army'.

articles.title: Macquarie’s Dutch Data Center Stake Sale Attracts Igneo, Orix
articles.description: Igneo Infrastructure Partners and Japan’s Orix Corp. are among those in the next round of bidding for Macquarie Asset Management’s majority stake in a Dutch hyperscale data center, according to people familiar with the matter.
